title: Blog: Four Reasons Reading Drives Us Mad - And Why We Still Keep At It
content: Most bookworms endure one or more of these ordeals, and yet, astonishingly, they continue to read. Most bookworms endure one or more of these ordeals, and yet, astonishingly, they continue to read.

title: Ferris Wheel Catches Fire, Leaves 30 Injured At Summer Festival In Germany

title: Educational Institutions Reopen After A Month In Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh on Sunday reopened all educational institutions, including universities, secondary schools and colleges, across the country after more than a month of closure due to violence centring the student-led protests.
summary: Bangladesh on Sunday reopened all educational institutions, including universities, secondary schools and colleges, across the country after more than a month of closure due to violence centring the student-led protests.

title: "They Were Men": Trump Again Slams Olympic Gold Medalists Amid Gender Row
content: Former US President Donald Trump once again sparked controversy by criticising two Olympic gold medalist female boxers, labelling them as men during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump once again sparked controversy by criticising two Olympic gold medalist female boxers, labelling them as men during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.

title: Elon Musk Compares Brazil's Chief Justice To Harry Potter Villain Voldemort

title: Opinion: Imane Khelif, And The Scourge Of 'Transvestigators'
content: The kind of bullying and abuse Olympic boxer Imane Khelif has been subjected to makes one thing clear: in the age of social media, misinformation is easiest to amplify when it's rooted in misogyny, transphobia and racism.
summary: The kind of bullying and abuse Olympic boxer Imane Khelif has been subjected to makes one thing clear: in the age of social media, misinformation is easiest to amplify when it's rooted in misogyny, transphobia and racism.

title: UK Girl Discovers Dinosaur Footprints On Beach Walk: "Cool And Exciting"
content: The enormous prints, spaced up to 75cm apart, are thought to have been made by a large herbivore from the late Triassic period.

title: Russia, Ukraine Were Set For Ceasefire Talks In Doha. Then A Shock Assault
content: Ukraine and Russia were on the brink of engaging in indirect ceasefire negotiations in Qatar's Doha this month. The discussions, mediated by Qatar, aimed at halting the destructive strikes on energy and power infrastructure.
summary: Ukraine and Russia were on the brink of engaging in indirect ceasefire negotiations in Qatar's Doha this month. The discussions, mediated by Qatar, aimed at halting the destructive strikes on energy and power infrastructure.

title: Shiveluch Volcano Erupts In Russia After 7.0 Magnitude Earthquake
content: Russia's Shiveluch volcano in the Kamchatka region erupted after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck off the eastern coast of the country, local media reported on Sunday.
summary: Russia's Shiveluch volcano in the Kamchatka region erupted after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck off the eastern coast of the country, local media reported on Sunday.

title: Donald Trump Calls Out Kamala Harris For Climate Misinformation
content: An unrelentingly bitter US presidential race, defined by name-calling, attack ads and stunted campaigning, has so far left little space for discussion about climate change, despite the world experiencing unprecedented heat and disasters.

title: Donald Trump Says He Is "Much Better Looking" Than Rival Kamala Harris

title: Kamala Harris Bets America Is Ready To Have Its 1st Black Woman President

title: "Illusion": Hamas Official Dismisses US Optimism Over Gaza Ceasefire Talks

title: 2 Killed In West Bank Strike, Israel Says It Targeted "Terrorist Cell''
content: Palestinian officials said two people were killed in an Israeli air strike in the occupied West Bank on Saturday that the Israeli military said targeted a "terrorist cell" in the Jenin area.

title: 7.0 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Russia, Several Aftershocks Recorded
content: A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck off the coast of Russia's far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early Sunday morning local time, according to the regional earthquake monitoring service.
summary: A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck off the coast of Russia's far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early Sunday morning local time, according to the regional earthquake monitoring service.

title: Gaza Records First Polio Case In 25 Years As UN Urges Vaccinations
content: Gaza has recorded its first polio case in 25 years, the Palestinian health ministry said on Friday, after UN chief Antonio Guterres called for pauses in the Israel-Hamas war to vaccinate hundreds of thousands of children.
summary: Gaza has recorded its first polio case in 25 years, the Palestinian health ministry said on Friday, after UN chief Antonio Guterres called for pauses in the Israel-Hamas war to vaccinate hundreds of thousands of children.
